channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed for thesixthaxis_com

item.title: Stranger Things is coming to Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024
item.content:encoded:
There’s a headline you were not expecting, but it’s true, the town of Hawkins from Netflix’s smash hit series Stranger Things is coming to Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024. The news was broken by the PlayStation Blog, something we wouldn’t have expected a few months ago either.

“An adrenaline-packed journey into the universe of the cult series awaits fans and simmers alike, led by Murray Bauman, from the original cast, and his team!” say PlayStation. “Enter the world of Netflix’s Stranger Things to help Hawkins, a town under lockdown, heavy patrols, and supernatural threats. ”

“Think you have what it takes to fly a Bell UH-1H Huey and help the residents of Hawkins in their latest encounters with the dangers that destroyed their hometown? Try your hand at five exhilarating missions, shady supply ops, close-call chases, and high-stakes rescues… all of it pulling you deeper into the city’s worst fears. No spoilers, but “Yeah, it gets intense!” as Murray would say.”

The Stranger Things DLC pack is completely free to all owners of Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024, and it is out today!

Source: PS Blog / YouTube



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/12/09/stranger-things-is-coming-to-microsoft-flight-simulator-2024/
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Ride 6 full bike and track list has been confirmed
item.content:encoded:
Milestone has confirmed every single bike and track that will be featured in Ride 6 when the game launches on February 12th. Players are going to be spoilt for choice with the bike roster including 289 different motorcycles, which can be rode around 39 different tracks around the world. With DLC, the eventual number of bikes will rise to 340. You can check out the full lists below.

  1. Ducati-Panigale V4 S – Endurance Modified (2025)

  3. KTM-1290 Super Adventure R (2024)

Tracks

  1. Circuito de Almeria (Spain)
  2. Autopolis (Japan)
  3. Blue Wave Arena (USA)
  4. Blue Wave Circuit (USA)
  5. Blue Wave Enduro (USA)
  6. Brands Hatch Circuit (UK)

  8. Canadian Tyre Motorsport Park (Canada)
  9. Kapadokya Rally (Turkey)
  10. Daytona International Speedway (USA)
  11. Donnington Park (UK)
  12. French Riviera (France)
  13. Fuji International Speedway (Japan)
  14. Gunma Mountain (Japan)
  15. Autodromo Enzo e Dino Ferrari Imola (Italy)
  16. Kanto Temples (Japan)
  17. Kyalami Grand Prix Circuit (South Africa)
  18. WeatherTech Raceway Laguna Seca (USA)
  19. 24 Heures du Mans Bugatti Circuit (France)
  20. Circuit De Nevers Magny-Cours (France)
  21. Autodromo Nazionale Di Monza (Italy)
  22. Mugello (Italy)
  23. Nevada (USA)
  24. Nürburgring Nordschleife (Germany)
  25. Nürburgring GP-Strecke (Germany)
  26. North West 200 (Northen Irland)
  27. Okayama International Circuit (Japan)
  28. Autódromo Internacional Algarve (Portugal)
  29. Red Bull Ring – Spielberg (Austria)
  30. Road America (USA)
  31. Michelin Raceway Road Atlanta (USA)
  32. Southern 100 (UK)
  33. Stelvio (Italy)
  34. Parco Enduro delle Alpi (Italy)
  35. Sportsland SUGO (Japan)
  36. Suzuka (Japan)
  37. Ulster GP (Northen Irland)
  38. Circuit Ricardo Tormo (Spain)
  39. Autodromo di Vallelunga (Italy)

Ride 6 has been developed using Unreal Engine 5 which has allowed Milestone to add in a new dual physics system. This is split between Pro for players who want to get right into the simulation side of Ride 6, and Arcade for players who just want to ride around without having to fiddle too much with different bike parts. The Riding School will allow players to learn different parts of the game and complete challenges, and Ride 6 will also support cross platform play multiplayer. Split screen multiplayer and a race creator are not going to be available at launch for Ride 6, but will come later down the line. The game will be available on PC, PS5, and Xbox Series XS.

Source: Steam
